p:
We have used GA because it is a potent inhibitor of HSP90 (nanomolar range) that is active against PV (
23 ). The presence of GA reduced the number of infections established by 22 ± 4%, with an IC 50 value of 30 ± 8 nM ( Fig. 3A). An earlier study did not observe an impact of GA prior to virus assembly; however, it is possible that a reduction of the magnitude shown here would be concealed by experimental error (
23 ). Because infection is monitored by eGFP, which requires virus entry, genome replication, and genome translation, interference with any of these steps would lead to a reduction in the number of eGFP-positive cells. It is clear, however, that translation and folding of eGFP are not altered in the presence of the highest concentration of GA used in this experiment (fig. S3).
